title: promise444c5
author: promise444c5
content: So d tin b say I Don post for local board sha but na my first topic be dis and d question be say na which crypto wallet dey easy to use wella for dis naija webi say  hin security dey tight one fit do transaction easily one fit operate without wahala  Please ,make everyone clear am wella even if na custodial abi no custodial  make we explain am clearly weybe sey everyone wey read about am and no understand crypto wella go sabi easily without stress.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Dear I think Electrum wallet dey better as na open source and e dey easy to operate than any other wallet wey we fit imagine onto say other wallet maybe easily open for hack. Usually I don try wallet like trustwallet I don experience issues but las las na electrum I take settled de matta. Me self no too sabi anything about wallet but from some post I dey read across the forum show say all fingers dey point that electrum wallet. Wallet plenty oo but I go advise say e better get the one way you get your private keys at hand than those wey be say na only password e required to login and do transfer. Especially no even try save your funds for exchange account because something fit happened to them and them go steal your funds onto say you no get total control of your money wey dey inside the exchange, na wetin make you supposed used electrum wallet and na open source wallet be that I think to my level na wetin I fit tell you. But our brother wey be Charles-Tim sabi all this wallet of a thing so I quote am so that him go explain more better for you about the open source and many more.

comments.body: Quote from: Sim_card on September 07, 2023, 03:06:43 PMSnipWell if op needs a wallet that he can sell his bitcoin directly I doubt if there's any except to wallet that can enable swapping between to different currencies but I doubt if bitcoin can be easily interacted with those wallet, so alternatively he can hold on exchange for easy trading and that means he has be very careful with his holding otherwise whatever that happens to the exchange might or will easily affect him or her as well if he his looking for simple way to trade his coin. I prefer to recommend open source wallets that support RBF and also having coin control and ability to do CPFP. Unstoppable wallet is open source but does not support some other coins and tokens, especially coins. The best for altcoins would have been to go for a hardware wallet which supports bitcoin and it is safer than online wallets, hardware wallets like Trezor. But there was a time a friend of mine was unable to spend one of his altcoins, he has no option than to go for Metamask. If not going for Unstoppable wallet, Trezor hardware wallet supports more coins.

I have used Electrum, Sparrow and Bluewallet and they are all good.Bluewallet is an ideal spot to start because it also supports the Bitcoin Lightning network and multi-addresses for anonymity. I'm sorry to say it, but there is no better multi-chain wallet than Trustwallet. It's not open source, but trust me when I say CZ knows what he's doing and it's really secure. It supports all altcoins and has the option to import any token that is not listed. Installing several wallets to save altcoins is risky. I would not recommend a hardware wallet to a newbie.To maintain a hardware wallet safe, one must first understand the fundamentals of security and storage.
